text: Kansas's 6th congressional district is an congressional district that is no longer in use for representation in the United States House of Representatives. It existed from 1885 to 1963. Bob Dole was the last person to represent the district. It was located in north central and northwest Kansas nearby Hays, with Goodland at the western edge of the district and Salina and Concordia at the eastern edge. == List of members representing the district == Member Party Years Cong ress Electoral history District created March 4, 1885 District created March 4, 1885 District created March 4, 1885 District created March 4, 1885 District created March 4, 1885 Lewis Hanback Republican March 4, 1885 – March 3, 1887 Redistricted from the and re-elected in 1884.
